intro: Licania, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Malvaceae family. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are characterized by their showy, often colorful flowers that resemble those of hibiscus species. Licania species usually have palmate leaves and produce capsules as their fruit type. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
